member.summary: Gets a sequence containing all the entities that currently own servers.

member.remarks: Each entity will appear in the sequence only once; regardless of the number of servers it owns. use the ServersOwnedByEntity method to find the number of servers an entity owns.

member.name: P:Simphony.Simulation.Resource.Servers
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of servers.
member.value: The total number of servers.

remarks.para: Setting this property will have no affect on the utilization statistic of the resource. If the number of servers needs to be modified during simulation, it is recommended that the AlterServers method of the simulation engine be called instead.

Setting this property will not affect the number of servers in use. If this property is set to a value less than the current number of servers in use, then the number of servers available will temporarily be negative until the appropriate number of servers is released.

The method to call when a state event is detected.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified state variable or the specified method is a null reference.

member.name: T:Simphony.Simulation.WatchDirection
member.summary: Specifies the possible directions in which a watch element can be triggered.

member.name: F:Simphony.Simulation.WatchDirection.Positive
member.summary: The watch element will be triggered when the value of the state variable rises from below the threshold to above the threshold.

member.name: F:Simphony.Simulation.WatchDirection.Negative
member.summary: The watch element will be triggered when the value of the state variable falls from above the threshold to below the threshold.

member.name: F:Simphony.Simulation.WatchDirection.Both
member.summary: The watch element will be triggered when the value of the state variable crosses the threshold in either direction.

member.name: M:Simphony.Simulation.Calendar.AddWorkingTime(System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a specified amount of working time to a specified date.
member.param: A date.
The amount of working time to add to the date.

True if the calculation should be conservative (i.e. if the result falls at the end of a shift, then the return value is time that shift ended); false if the calculation should be generous (i.e. if the result falls at the end of a shift, then the return value is the time that the next shift starts). The default is true.
member.returns: A date that is the specified date plus the specified working time.
member.remarks: This method accepts negative time spans (in which case working time will be subtracted from the specified date).

True if the calculation should be conservative (i.e. if the result falls at the start of a shift, then the return value is time that shift started); false if the calculation should be generous (i.e. if the result falls at the start of a shift, then the return value is the time that the previous shift ends). The default is true.
member.returns: A date that is the specified date less the specified working time.
member.remarks: This method accepts negative time spans (in which case working time will be added to the specified date).

member.summary: Implementation of the Metropolis-Hastings algorithm that generates a sequence of random deviates from a probability distribution whose density is proportional to a specified function.

The number of samples to generate.
An arbitrary starting point that will be the beginning of the random walk.
The variance of the normal distribution to be used to generate the random walk.
member.returns: An array containing the samples.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified function is a null reference.
Thrown if the specified starting point is infinite or NaN; if the specified number of iterations is zero or negative; or if the specified variance is zero, negative, infinite, or NaN.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.MathEx.RungeKuttaFehlberg(System.Action{System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[]},System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double,Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag@)
member.summary: Carries out Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg integration.
member.param: A user-supplied method of the form f(t, y, yp) used to evaluate the derivatives.
The current solution vector at .
The derivative of the current solution vector at . The user should not set or alter this information.
The current value of the independent variable.
The output point at which a solution is desired. A value equal to is permitted on the first call only, in which case the routine will return with a of if continuation is possible.
The relative error tolerance.
The absolute error tolerance.
A value indicating the status of integration.
member.exception: Thrown if the user-supplied method, the solution vector, or the vector containing the derivatives is a null reference.
Thrown if the specified relative or absolute error tolerance is negative.

remarks.para: This routine is primarily designed to solve non-stiff and mildly stiff differential equations when derivative evaluations are inexpensive. It should generally not be used when the user is demanding high accuracy.
This routine integrates a system of first-order ordinary differential equations of the form: dy(i)/dt = f(t, y(1), y(2), ... ,y(n)) where the y(1) ... y(n) are given at t.

Typically the subroutine is used to integrate from to but it can be used as a one-step integrator to advance the solution a single step in the direction of . On return, the parameters in the call list are set for continuing the integration. The user has only to call again (and perhaps define a new value for ).

Before the first call, the user must:
Supply the subroutine f(t, y, yp) to evaluate the right hand side; and
Initialize the parameters. In particular, should be set to the starting point for integration, should contain the value of the initial conditions, should be allocated to have the same length as , and should be set to either or .

Normally, the user only sets the value of before the first call, and thereafter the algorithm manages the value. On the first call, should be set to or . On normal return, will have been reset to or , and the user can continue to call the routine with that value of .

The routine returns with all the information needed to continue the integration. If the integration reached , the user need only define a new And call again. In the one-step integrator mode, returning with a of , the user must keep in mind that each step taken is in the direction of the current . Upon reaching , indicated by the output value of switching to , the user must define a new and reset the flag to to continue in the one-step integrator mode.

In some cases, an error or difficulty occurs during a call. In that case, the output value of is used to indicate that there is a problem that the user must address. These values include:
Integration was not completed because the specified relative error tolerance was too small. The relative error tolerance has been increased appropriately for continuing. If the new value is acceptable, recall with either the or flags.
Integration was not completed because more than 3,000 derivative evaluations were needed. This is approximately 500 steps. The user may continue by simply calling again. The function counter will be reset to 0, and another 3,000 function evaluations are allowed.
Integration was not completed because the solution vanished, making a pure relative error test impossible. The user must use a non-zero absolute error tolerance to continue. Using the one-step integration mode for one step is a good way to proceed.
Integration was not completed because the requested accuracy could not be achieved, even using the smallest allowable step size. The user must increase the absolute or relative error tolerances before continuing. It is also necessary to reset the flag to either or . This result indicates a trouble spot — the solution is changing rapidly, or a singularity may be present. It often is inadvisable to continue.
It is likely that the Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg method is inefficient for solving this particular problem. Too much output is restricting the natural step size choice. The user should use the one-step integration mode with the step size determined by the code. If the user insists upon continuing the integration, reset the flag to either or before calling again.

References:
Erwin Fehlberg, Low-order Classical Runge-Kutta Formulas with Stepsize Control, NASA Technical Report R-315, 1969.
Lawrence Shampine, Herman Watts, S Davenport, Solving Non-stiff Ordinary Differential Equations - The State of the Art, SIAM Review, Volume 18, pages 376-411, 1976.
Based on the original FORTRAN77 version by Herman Watts and Lawrence Shampine; and on the C++ version by John Burkardt released under the LGPL license.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.MathEx.ZeroIn(System.Double,System.Func{System.Double,System.Double},System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the root of a function f known to lie near a real argument x.
member.param: The starting point for the search.
The function under investigation.
The acceptable tolerance.
member.returns: An estimate of the root.
member.remarks: This method is an implementation of the Van Wijngaarden-Dekker-Brent algorithm. For details see Section 9.3 of: Press, W.H., Teukolsky, S.A., Vetterling, W.T., and Flannery, B.P., (1992) Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified starting point is infinite or NaN.
Thrown if the specified function is a null reference.
Thrown if the function is undefined at the specified starting point; or if an interval containing the starting point and the root cannot be found.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.MathEx.ZeroIn(System.Double,System.Double,System.Func{System.Double,System.Double},System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the root of a function f known to lie between real arguments a and b.
member.param: The left-most point of the interval to search.
The right-most point of the interval to search.
The function under investigation.
The acceptable tolerance.
member.returns: An estimate of the root.
member.remarks: This method is an implementation of the Van Wijngaarden-Dekker-Brent algorithm. For details see Section 9.3 of: Press, W.H., Teukolsky, S.A., Vetterling, W.T., and Flannery, B.P., (1992) Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press.
member.exception: Thrown if either of the specified endpoints is infinite or NaN.
Thrown if the specified function is a null reference.

Thrown if the function is undefined at either of the endpoints or if the values of the function at the endpoints do not have opposite signs; i.e. if the specified interval cannot be guaranteed to contain a root.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.MathEx.CentralMoments(System.Nullable{System.Decimal}[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Two pass calculation of the central moments of a set of data ignoring null values.
member.param: The data to calculate the central moments of.
The highest order central moment to return.
member.returns: An array containing the central moments of the data.
member.remarks: The j-th element in the returned array will contain the j-th central moment, which is defined to be 1/n∑(xi-μ)j. Note that this method will return the size of the data set in the 0-th position rather than the correct value of 1, and it will return the mean of the data set in the 1-st position rather than the correct value of 0.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified array of data is a null reference.
Thrown if the value of the parameter k is negative.
Thrown if the array contains no non-null values.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.MarkovChain.BaumWelch(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Runs the Baum-Welch learning algorithm for hidden Markov models.
member.param: An array containing a sequence of observations to be used to train the model.

The maximum number of iterations to be performed by the learning algorithm. If specified as zero, the algorithm will learn until convergence of the model average likelihood respecting the desired limit.

The likelihood convergence limit L between two iterations of the algorithm. The algorithm will stop when the change in the likelihood for two consecutive iterations has not changed by more than L percent of the likelihood. If left as zero, the algorithm will ignore this parameter and iterates over a number of fixed iterations specified by the previous parameter.
member.returns: The average log-likelihood for the observations after the model has been trained.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified array of observations is a null reference.
Thrown if either the specified maximum number of iterations or the specified tolerance is negative.

Thrown if the specified array of observations is empty; if the specified array of observations contains an invalid observation; or if the specified maximum number of iterations and the specified tolerance are both zero.

member.summary: Determines the number of bins using the Rice rule.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.BinningMethod.SquareRoot
member.summary: Determines the number of bins using the square-root choice.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.BinningMethod.SturgesRule
member.summary: Determines the number of bins using Sturge's Rule.

member.name: T:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag
member.summary: Possible values for the flag parameter of the Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg method.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.NormalMode
member.summary: As a parameter, indicates the first call to the RKF45 algorithm and that the algorithm should execute in normal mode; never a return value.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.NormalModeContinuation
member.summary: As a parameter, indicates a subsequent call to the RKF45 algorithm (initialization work can be skipped) and that the algorithm should execute in normal mode; as a return value, indicates normal progress and that the specified output point has been reached.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.SingleStepMode
member.summary: As a parameter, indicates the first call to the RKF45 algorithm and that the algorithm should execute in single step mode; never a return value.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.SingleStepModeContinuation
member.summary: As a parameter, indicates a subsequent call to the RKF45 algorithm (initialization work can be skipped) and that the algorithm should execute in single step mode; as a return value, indicates normal progress and that the specified output point has not yet been reached.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.WarningInefficient
member.summary: Indicates that it is likely that the Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg method is inefficient for solving this problem.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.WarningPossibleSingularity
member.summary: Indicates that integration was not completed because the requested accuracy could not be achieved, even using the smallest allowable step size.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.WarningRelativeErrorTooSmall
member.summary: Indicates that integration was not completed because the specified relative error tolerance was too small.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.WarningSolutionVanished
member.summary: Indicates that integration was not completed because the solution vanished, making a pure relative error test impossible.

member.name: F:Simphony.Mathematics.IntegrationFlag.WarningTooManySteps
member.summary: Indicates that integration was not completed because an excessive number of derivative evaluations were needed.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.Matrix.Bvls(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Double[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Solves a least squares problem with bounds on the variables: Given an M by N matrix A, and an M-vector B, computes an N-vector X, that solves the least-squares problem A * X = B subject to X[J] satisfying BL[J] <= X[J] <= BU[J].
member.param: On entry, the M x N matrix A. On return, the product matrix Q * A, where Q is an M x M orthogonal matrix generated by this routine.
On entry, the M-vector B. On return, the product Q * B. The same Q multiplies A.
An N-vector containing the lower bounds for the components of X. Use to indicate no lower bound.
An N-vector containing the upper bounds for the components of X. Use to indicate no upper bound.
On return, the solution N-vector X.
On return, the Euclidean norm of the residual vector, B - A * X.
On return, the number of components of the solution vector X, that are not at their constraint values.

On return, the dual solution N-vector. It is defined as follows: W[J] = 0 for all J in the set P; W[J] <= 0 for all J in set Z such that X[J] is at its lower bound; and W[J] >= 0 for all J in set Z such that X[J] is at its upper bound. If BL[J] = BU[J], so that X[J] is fixed, then W[J] will have an arbitrary value.

On return, an integer array of size N defined as follows: INDEX[0] through INDEX[NSETP - 1] = the set P; INDEX[IZ1] through INDEX[IZ2] = the set Z; and INDEX[IZ2 + 1] through INDEX[N - 1] = the set F. Any of these sets may be empty. Set F is those components of X that are constrained to a unique value by the given constraints. Sets P and Z are those that are allowed a non-zero range of values. Of these, set Z are those whose final value is a constraint value, while set P are those whose final value is not a constraint. The value of IZ2 is not returned -- it is computable as the number of bounds constraining a component of X uniquely.

remarks.para: Based on the Fortran 90 routine BVLS by Charles Lawson & Richard Hanson found here: http://people.math.sc.edu/Burkardt/f_src/bvls/bvls.html.
See: Lawson, C. L., & Hanson, R. J., Solving Least Squares Problems. SIAM, 1995.

member.exception: Thrown if any of the input arrays are a null reference.
Thrown if any of the input arrays are of incorrect size with respect to the matrix A.
Thrown if the lower and upper bounds are inconsistent; i.e. if BL[J] > BU[J] for some J.
Thrown if the maximum number of iterations is exceeded.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.Matrix.Lubksb(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Int32[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Solves a system of linear equations Ax = b.
member.param: The LU decomposition of the matrix A as returned by Ludcmp.
The permutation vector returned by Ludcmp.
When this method is called, the right-hand vector b. When this method returns, the solution vector x.
member.remarks: For details see Section 2.3 of: Press, W.H., Teukolsky, S.A., Vetterling, W.T., and Flannery, B.P., (1992) Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press.
member.exception: Thrown if any of the specified parameters is a null reference.

member.summary: Generates the LU decomposition of a matrix.
member.param: When this method is called, the matrix to be decomposed. When this method returns, the LU decomposition of the matrix.
When this method returns, a vector that records the row permutation effected by the partial pivoting.
When this method returns, either +1 or -1 depending on whether the number of row interchanges was even or odd respectively.
member.remarks: This method is an implementation of Crout's algorithm. For details see Section 2.3 of: Press, W.H., Teukolsky, S.A., Vetterling, W.T., and Flannery, B.P., (1992) Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified matrix is a null reference.
Thrown if the specified matrix is not a square matrix.
Thrown if the specified matrix is a singular matrix.

member.name: T:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer
member.summary: An implementation of the downhill simplex method of nonlinear optimization of Nelder and Mead.
member.remarks: See Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C for details of this algorithm.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Maximize(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Maximizes the function defined by the current instance.
member.param: A vector containing an initial guess for the maximum.
A value giving a rough idea of the size of the starting simplex - see Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C for details.
The desired tolerance.
member.returns: A vector at which the function defined by the current instance takes on a maximum value.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Maximize(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Maximizes the function defined by the current instance.
member.param: A vector containing an initial guess for the maximum.
A value giving a rough idea of the size of the starting simplex - see Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C for details.
The desired tolerance.
When the method exits, a vector at which the function defined by the current instance takes on a maximum value.
member.returns: True if the simplex converged; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Minimize(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Minimizes the function defined by the current instance.
member.param: A vector containing an initial guess for the minimum.
A value giving a rough idea of the size of the starting simplex - see Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C for details.
The desired tolerance.
member.returns: A vector at which the function defined by the current instance takes on a minimal value.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Minimize(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Minimizes the function defined by the current instance.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.ObjectiveFunction(System.Double[])
member.summary: Evaluates the function to be optimized.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Amoeba(System.Double[][],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Func{System.Double[],System.Double})
member.summary: Multidimensional minimization of a function from n-dimensional Euclidean space to the real line, by the downhill simplex method of Nelder and Mead.
member.param: An n+1 x n dimensional matrix whose rows are the vertices of the starting simplex. When the method returns, all vertices of the simplex will be within the specified tolerance of a minimum function value.

An n+1 dimensional vector whose components have been pre-initialized to the values of the function at each of the vertices of the starting simplex. When the method returns, the components will be set to the values of the function at each of the vertices of the final simplex.
The fractional convergence tolerance to be achieved in the function value.
The function to minimize.
member.remarks: See Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.Minimize(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Func{System.Double[],System.Double},System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Minimizes the specified function.
member.param: A vector containing an initial guess for the minimum.
A value giving a rough idea of the size of the starting simplex - see Section 10.4 of Numerical Recipes in C for details.
The desired tolerance.
The function to minimize.
When the method exits, a vector at which the function takes on a minimal value.
member.returns: True if the simplex converged; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.MaximizeFunction(System.Double[])
member.summary: Evaluates the objective function in order to maximize it.
member.param: The vector at which to evaluate the function.
member.returns: The negated value of the function at the specified vector if defined; otherwise positive infinity.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.SimplexOptimizer.MinimizeFunction(System.Double[])
member.summary: Evaluates the objective function in order to minimize it.
member.param: The vector at which to evaluate the function.
member.returns: The value of the function at the specified vector if defined; otherwise positive infinity.

member.name: T:Simphony.Mathematics.DistributionConverter.InfoTypeConverter
member.summary: This custom type converter is used to make the entries in the property grid uneditable. The property grid ignores the IsReadOnly property when the GetCreateInstanceSupported() method returns true and it does not appear to be possible to alter this behaviour. It also does not appear possible to get the property grid to render the cell as grayed-out in this case.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.Distribution.ChiSquaredTest(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Uses Pearson's chi-square test to assess the goodness of fit between the current distribution and a specified collection of data grouped into a specified number of bins.
member.param: A collection containing the data to test against the current distribution.
The number of bins into which the data should be grouped.
The significance level of the test.
member.returns: True if the null hypothesis is not rejected at the significance level of alpha (i.e. the data passes the test); otherwise false.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified collection is a null reference.
Thrown if the specified number of bins is less than 2.
Thrown if the specified collection is empty.

For other shape factors, see algorithm GD in: Ahrens, J. H., & Dieter, U. Generating gamma variates by a modified rejection technique. Communications of the ACM, 25, 47-54.

member.name: M:Simphony.Mathematics.Normal.BayesianUpdateTae(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Generates a new distribution that represents the prior (current) distribution updated with new data using Bayesian techniques.

The value. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the parameter.
Pointer to application specific data. This is the data pointed to by the member of structure used to create the task dialog.

member.param: A handle to the device context.
A pointer to a RECT structure that contains the logical coordinates of the rectangle to be filled.
A handle to the brush used to fill the rectangle.
member.returns: Nonzero if the function succeeds; otherwise zero.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.FindWindowEx(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. The function searches child windows, beginning with the one following the specified child window. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search.
member.param: A handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be searched. If is NULL, the function uses the desktop window as the parent window, and the function searches among windows that are child windows of the desktop.

A handle to a child window. The search begins with the next child window in the Z order. The child window must be a direct child window of , not just a descendant window. If is NULL, the search begins with the first child window of .
The window class name.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is NULL, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class and window names. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetButtons(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Converts the wParam parameter of a message to a value.

member.returns: The wParam parameter converted to a value.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetClientRect(System.IntPtr,Simphony.NativeMethods.RECT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the coordinates of a window's client area. The client coordinates specify the upper-left and lower-right corners of the client area. Because client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of a window's client area, the coordinates of the upper-left corner are (0,0).
member.param: A handle to the window whose client coordinates are to be retrieved.
A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the client coordinates. The left and top members are zero. The right and bottom members contain the width and height of the window.
member.returns: True if the function succeeds; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetClipboardData(System.UInt32)

member.param: A clipboard format.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to a clipboard object in the specified format. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetCurrentThreadId
member.summary: Retrieves the thread identifier of the calling thread.
member.returns: The return value is the thread identifier of the calling thread.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetCursorPos(Simphony.NativeMethods.POINT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the position of the mouse cursor, in screen coordinates.

member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful or zero otherwise.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetDeviceCaps(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetDlgItem(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

The identifier of the control to be retrieved.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetFocus

member.returns: The return value is the handle to the window with the keyboard focus. If the calling thread's message queue does not have an associated window with the keyboard focus, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the foreground window. The foreground window can be NULL in certain circumstances, such as when a window is losing activation.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetIconInfo(System.IntPtr,Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the specified icon or cursor.
member.param: A handle to the icon or cursor.
A pointer to an structure. The function fills in the structure's members.
member.returns: True if the function succeeds; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetMenuState(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the menu flags associated with the specified menu item. If the menu item opens a submenu, this function also returns the number of items in the submenu.
member.param: A handle to the menu that contains the menu item whose flags are to be retrieved.
The menu item for which the menu flags are to be retrieved, as determined by the parameter.
Indicates how the parameter is interpreted.
member.returns: If the specified item does not exist, the return value is -1. If the menu item opens a submenu, the low-order byte of the return value contains the menu flags associated with the item, and the high-order byte contains the number of items in the submenu opened by the item. Otherwise, the return value is a mask (Bitwise OR) of the menu flags.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetParent(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the specified window's parent or owner.
member.param: A handle to the window whose parent window handle is to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the window is a child window, the return value is a handle to the parent window; if the window is a top-level window with the WS_POPUP style, the return value is a handle to the owner window; if the function fails, the return value is NULL.

The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the pixel to be examined.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetScrollInfo(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,Simphony.NativeMethods.SCROLLINFO@)
member.summary: The function retrieves the parameters of a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (thumb).

Specifies the type of scroll bar for which to retrieve parameters.

Pointer to a structure. Before calling , set the member to sizeof(), and set the member to specify the scroll bar parameters to retrieve. Before returning, the function copies the specified parameters to the appropriate members of the structure.
member.returns: If the function retrieved any values, the return value is nonzero. If the function does not retrieve any values, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetStockObject(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetSysColor(System.Int32)

member.param: The display element whose color is to be retrieved.
member.returns: The function returns the red, green, blue (RGB) color value of the given element.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetSysColorBrush(System.Int32)
member.summary: The function retrieves a handle identifying a logical brush that corresponds to the specified color index.
member.param: A color index. This value corresponds to the color used to paint one of the window elements.
member.returns: The return value identifies a logical brush if the parameter is supported by the current platform. Otherwise, it returns NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.
member.param: A handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

The action to be taken. If this parameter is false, the method returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is true, the method resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.
member.returns: If the parameter is false, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu. If the parameter is true, the return value is null.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetSystemMetrics(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified system metric or system configuration setting.
member.param: The system metric or configuration setting to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the requested system metric or configuration setting; if the function fails, the return value is 0.

A pointer to a buffer that specifies the text string. The string does not need to be null-terminated, because the parameter specifies the length of the string.
The length of the string pointed to by .
A pointer to a structure that receives the dimensions of the string, in logical units.
member.returns: True if the function succeeds; otherwise, false.

A value that specifies the state of the part.
Pointer to a structure that contains the total background rectangle, in logical coordinates. This is the area inside the borders or margins.
Pointer to a structure that receives the content area background rectangle, in logical coordinates. This rectangle is calculated to fit the content area.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns . Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetWindowDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves the device context (DC) for the entire window, including title bar, menus, and scroll bars. A window device context permits painting anywhere in a window, because the origin of the device context is the upper-left corner of the window instead of the client area.
member.param: A handle to the window with a device context that is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, the device context for the entire screen is retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to a device context for the specified window. If the function fails, the return value is NULL, indicating an error or an invalid parameter.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,Simphony.NativeMethods.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)

member.returns: True if the function succeeds; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalAlloc(System.UInt32,System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Allocates the specified number of bytes from the heap.
member.param: The memory allocation attributes. If zero is specified, the default is .
The number of bytes to allocate. If this parameter is zero and the parameter specifies GMEM_MOVEABLE, the function returns a handle to a memory object that is marked as discarded.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the newly allocated memory object; if the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalLock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Locks a global memory object and returns a pointer to the first byte of the object's memory block.
member.param: A handle to the global memory object. This handle is returned by either the or function.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a pointer to the first byte of the memory block; if the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalMemoryStatusEx(Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the system's current usage of both physical and virtual memory.
member.param: A pointer to a MEMORYSTATUSEX structure that receives information about current memory availability.
member.returns: True if the function succeeds; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalReAlloc(System.IntPtr,System.UIntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Changes the size or attributes of a specified global memory object. The size can increase or decrease.
member.param: A handle to the global memory object to be reallocated. This handle is returned by either the or function.
The new size of the memory block, in bytes. If specifies , this parameter is ignored.
The reallocation options. If is specified, the function modifies the attributes of the memory object only (the parameter is ignored.) Otherwise, the function reallocates the memory object.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the reallocated memory object; if the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalSize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves the current size of the specified global memory object, in bytes.
member.param: A handle to the global memory object. This handle is returned by either the or function.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the size of the specified global memory object, in bytes. If the specified handle is not valid or if the object has been discarded, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.GlobalUnlock(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Decrements the lock count associated with a memory object that was allocated with . This function has no effect on memory objects allocated with .
member.param: A handle to the global memory object. This handle is returned by either the or function.
member.returns: If the memory object is still locked after decrementing the lock count, the return value is a nonzero value. If the memory object is unlocked after decrementing the lock count, the function returns zero and GetLastError returns NO_ERROR. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.HIWORD(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the high-order word from the specified 32-bit value.
member.param: The value to be converted.
member.returns: The return value is the high-order word of the specified value.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.InflateRect(Simphony.NativeMethods.RECT@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The function increases or decreases the width and height of the specified rectangle. The function adds units to the left and right ends of the rectangle and units to the top and bottom. The and parameters are signed values; positive values increase the width and height, and negative values decrease them.
member.param: A pointer to the structure that increases or decreases in size.
The amount to increase or decrease the rectangle width. This parameter must be negative to decrease the width.
The amount to increase or decrease the rectangle height. This parameter must be negative to decrease the height.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.MulDiv(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies two 32-bit values and then divides the 64-bit result by a third 32-bit value. The final result is rounded to the nearest integer.
member.param: The multiplicand.
The multiplier.
The number by which the result of the multiplication operation is to be divided.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the result of the multiplication and division, rounded to the nearest integer. If the result is a positive half integer (ends in .5), it is rounded up. If the result is a negative half integer, it is rounded down. If either an overflow occurred or was 0, the return value is -1.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.OpenClipboard(System.IntPtr)

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.OpenThemeData(System.IntPtr,System.String)

member.summary: The function sets the parameters of a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (thumb). The function also redraws the scroll bar, if requested.
member.param: Handle to a scroll bar control or a window with a standard scroll bar, depending on the value of the parameter.
Specifies the type of scroll bar for which to set parameters.

Pointer to a structure. Before calling , set the member of the structure to sizeof(), set the member to indicate the parameters to set, and specify the new parameter values in the appropriate members.
Specifies whether the scroll bar is redrawn to reflect the changes to the scroll bar. If this parameter is TRUE, the scroll bar is redrawn, otherwise, it is not redrawn.
member.returns: The return value is the current position of the scroll box.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. These windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: A handle to the window.
A handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order. This parameter must be a window handle or one of the following values: , , , or .
The new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
The new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
The window sizing and positioning flags.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero; if the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,Simphony.NativeMethods.HOOKPROC,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.param: The type of hook procedure to be installed.

A pointer to the hook procedure. If the parameter is zero or specifies the identifier of a thread created by a different process, the parameter must point to a hook procedure in a DLL. Otherwise, can point to a hook procedure in the code associated with the current process.

A handle to the DLL containing the hook procedure pointed to by the parameter. The parameter must be set to NULL if the parameter specifies a thread created by the current process and if the hook procedure is within the code associated with the current process.

The identifier of the thread with which the hook procedure is to be associated. For desktop apps, if this parameter is zero, the hook procedure is associated with all existing threads running in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure; if the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.SetWindowTheme(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Causes a window to use a different set of visual style information than its class normally uses.
member.param: Handle to the window whose visual style information is to be changed.
Pointer to a string that contains the application name to use in place of the calling application's name. If this parameter is NULL, the calling application's name is used.

Pointer to a string that contains a semicolon-separated list of CLSID names to use in place of the actual list passed by the window's class. If this parameter is NULL, the ID list from the calling class is used.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns . Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's show state.
member.param: A handle to the window.
Controls how the window is to be shown.
member.returns: True if the window was previously visible; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Simphony.NativeMethods.StretchBlt(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Copies a bitmap from a source rectangle into a destination rectangle, stretching or compressing the bitmap to fit the dimensions of the destination rectangle, if necessary. The system stretches or compresses the bitmap according to the stretching mode currently set in the destination device context.
member.param: A handle to the destination device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The width, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.
The height, in logical units, of the destination rectangle.
A handle to the source device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.
The width, in logical units, of the source rectangle.
The height, in logical units, of the source rectangle.
A raster-operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle is to be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color.

member.name: T:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO
member.summary: Contains information about an icon or a cursor.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO.fIcon
member.summary: Specifies whether this structure defines an icon or a cursor. A value of true specifies an icon; false specifies a cursor.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO.xHotspot
member.summary: The x-coordinate of the cursor's hot spot. If this structure defines an icon, the hot spot is always in the center of the icon, and this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO.yHotspot
member.summary: The y-coordinate of the cursor's hot spot. If this structure defines an icon, the hot spot is always in the center of the icon, and this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO.hbmMask
member.summary: The icon bitmask bitmap. If this structure defines a black and white icon, this bitmask is formatted so that the upper half is the icon AND bitmask and the lower half is the icon XOR bitmask. Under this condition, the height should be an even multiple of two. If this structure defines a color icon, this mask only defines the AND bitmask of the icon.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.ICONINFO.hbmColor
member.summary: A handle to the icon color bitmap. This member can be optional if this structure defines a black and white icon. The AND bitmask of is applied with the flag to the destination; subsequently, the color bitmap is applied (using XOR) to the destination by using the flag.

member.name: T:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX
member.summary: Contains information about the current state of both physical and virtual memory, including extended memory. The GlobalMemoryStatusEx function stores information in this structure.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.dwLength
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.dwMemoryLoad
member.summary: A number between 0 and 100 that specifies the approximate percentage of physical memory that is in use (0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use).

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalPhys
member.summary: The amount of actual physical memory, in bytes.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailPhys
member.summary: The amount of physical memory currently available, in bytes. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalPageFile
member.summary: The current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller, in bytes. To get the system-wide committed memory limit, call GetPerformanceInfo.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailPageFile
member.summary: The maximum amount of memory the current process can commit, in bytes. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value. To calculate the system-wide available commit value, call GetPerformanceInfo and subtract the value of CommitTotal from the value of CommitLimit.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullTotalVirtual
member.summary: The size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailVirtual
member.summary: The amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process, in bytes.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.MEMORYSTATUSEX.ullAvailExtendedVirtual
member.summary: Reserved. This value is always 0.

member.summary: Spacing between lines. For a description of how this value is interpreted, see the member. To use this member, set the flag in the member.

member.summary: Text style. To use this member, set the flag in the member. This member is included only for compatibility with TOM interfaces and Word; the rich edit control stores the value but does not use it to display the text.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.bLineSpacingRule
member.summary: Type of line spacing. To use this member, set the flag in the member.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.bOutlineLevel
member.summary: Reserved; must be zero.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wShadingWeight
member.summary: Percentage foreground color used in shading. The member specifies the foreground and background shading colors. A value of 5 indicates a shading color consisting of 5 percent foreground color and 95 percent background color. To use these members, set the flag in the member. This member is included only for compatibility with Word; the rich edit control stores the value but does not use it to display the text.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wShadingStyle
member.summary: Style and colors used for background shading. Bits 0 to 3 contain the shading style, bits 4 to 7 contain the foreground color index, and bits 8 to 11 contain the background color index. To use this member, set the flag in the member. This member is included only for compatibility with Word; the rich edit control stores the value but does not use it to display the text.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wNumberingStart
member.summary: Starting number or Unicode value used for numbered paragraphs. Use this member in conjunction with the member. This member is included only for compatibility with TOM interfaces; the rich edit control stores the value but does not use it to display the text or bullets. To use this member, set the flag in the member.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wNumberingStyle
member.summary: Numbering style used with numbered paragraphs. Use this member in conjunction with the member. This member is included only for compatibility with TOM interfaces; the rich edit control stores the value but rich edit versions earlier than 3.0 do not use it to display the text or bullets. To use this member, set the flag in the member.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wNumberingTab
member.summary: Minimum space between a paragraph number and the paragraph text, in twips. Use this member in conjunction with the wNumbering member. member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wBorderWidth

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.PARAFORMAT2.wBorders
member.summary: Border location, style, and color. Bits 0 to 7 specify the border locations, bits 8 to 11 specify the border style, and bits 12 to 15 specify the border color index. To use this member, set the flag in the member.

member.summary: Flags specifying the behavior of the task dialog.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.dwCommonButtons
member.summary: Flags specifying the push buttons displayed in the task dialog. If no common buttons are specified and no custom buttons are specified using the and members, the task dialog will contain the OK button by default.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszWindowTitle
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the task dialog title.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.hMainIcon
member.summary: A handle to an Icon that is to be displayed in the task dialog. This member is ignored unless the flag is specified. If this member is NULL and the is specified, no icon will be displayed.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszMainInstruction
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the main instruction.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszContent
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the dialog's primary content. If the flag is specified, then this string may contain HTML type hyperlinks.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.cButtons
member.summary: The number of entries in the array that is used to create buttons or command links in the task dialog. If this member is zero and no common buttons have been specified using the member, then the task dialog will have a single OK button displayed.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pButtons
member.summary: Pointer to an array of structures containing the definition of the custom buttons that are to be displayed in the task dialog. This array must contain at least the number of entries that are specified by the member.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.nDefaultButton
member.summary: The default button for the task dialog. This may be any of the values specified in members of one of the structures in the array, or one of the IDs corresponding to the buttons specified in the member.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.cRadioButtons
member.summary: The number of entries in the array that is used to create radio buttons in the task dialog.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pRadioButtons
member.summary: Pointer to an array of structures containing the definition of the radio buttons that are to be displayed in the task dialog. This array must contain at least the number of entries that are specified by the member. This parameter can be NULL.

member.name: F:Simphony.NativeMethods.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.nDefaultRadioButton
member.summary: The button ID of the radio button that is selected by default. If this value does not correspond to a button ID, the first button in the array is selected by default.
